perturbation.original_text:
Sponsor will be the exclusive retail music store sponsor of the Excite Site and the Excite Broadcast Pages. Excite will not permit the display of advertising banners, promotional buttons, promotional links or other promotional materials for any retail sale of Music Products on the Excite Site, except those Music Products offered by Sponsor, nor advertising by any other Retail Music Store. "Retail Music Store" shall mean any entity which is primarily engaged in the sale of Music Products at retail to consumers. "Music Products"     2                                                                     CONFIDENTIAL

              shall mean pre-recorded music hard goods, digitally                  distributed music (except live and/or cybercast events), music                  books (to the extent this Agreement does not conflict with                  Excite's existing agreement with Amazon.com), music-related                  t-shirts and apparel, and music videos (except live and/or                  cybercast events).

              Notwithstanding the foregoing, Excite may make available                  opportunities on the Excite Site to purchase Music Products                  from parties other than Sponsor if such Music Products are not                  available from Sponsor so long as, prior to entering into                  arrangements to make available opportunities to purchase Music                  Products from parties other than Sponsor, Excite notifies                  Sponsor of its interest in the Music Products and gives Sponsor                  thirty (30) days to make the desired Music Products available                  through the Sponsor Site. Excite and Sponsor acknowledge that                  certain market opportunities may arise in which the desired                  Music Products must be made available on less than thirty (30)                  days advance notice and will work together in good faith to                  maximize those opportunities. In no event will Excite enter                  into arrangements to make available opportunities to purchase                  Music Products from parties other than Sponsor that would                  prevent Sponsor from being the exclusive source of such Music                  Products on the Excite Site once the Music Products become                  available through Sponsor.
perturbation.changed_text:
Sponsor will be the exclusive retail music store sponsor of the Excite Site and the Excite Broadcast Pages. Excite will not permit the display of advertising banners, promotional buttons, promotional links or other promotional materials for any retail sale of Music Products on the Excite Site, except those Music Products offered by Sponsor, nor advertising by any other Retail Music Store. "Retail Music Store" shall mean any entity which is primarily engaged in the sale of Music Products at retail to consumers. "Music Products"     2                                                                     CONFIDENTIAL

              shall mean pre-recorded music hard goods, digitally                  distributed music (except live and/or cybercast events), music                  books (to the extent this Agreement does not conflict with                  Excite's existing agreement with Amazon.com), music-related                  t-shirts and apparel, and music videos (except live and/or                  cybercast events).

              Notwithstanding the foregoing, Excite may make available                  opportunities on the Excite Site to purchase Music Products                  from parties other than Sponsor even if such Music Products are available from Sponsor. Excite is not obligated to notify the sponsor about any new parties before entering into arrangements to purchase music products. Excite has the sole right to make available opportunities to purchase Music Products from parties other than Sponsor that would prevent Sponsor from being the exclusive source of such Music Products on the Excite Site once the Music Products become available through Sponsor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Excite will not permit advertising by any other Retail Music Store and may make available opportunities to purchase Music Products from parties other than Sponsor if such Music Products are not available from Sponsor. In contrast, the modified text contradicts this exclusivity and notification requirement. It allows Excite to make such opportunities available even if the products are available from Sponsor and states that Excite is not obligated to notify the sponsor about any new parties before entering into arrangements to purchase music products, destroying the exclusivity agreement. The last statement also contradicts the original text, where it states that Excite will not enter into arrangements that would prevent Sponsor from being the exclusive source, but is now stating that Excite has the sole right to make available opportunities to purchase Music Products from parties other than Sponsor that would prevent Sponsor from being the exclusive source.

perturbation.original_text: All data concerning users and their behavior relating to the                   use of the Excite Site will be owned solely by Excite. Data                   relating to the use of Sponsor's Site (excluding users                   referred from the Excite Site) will be owned solely by                   Sponsor. Data relating to the use of the Co-Branded Pages will                   be jointly owned and shared by both parties.
perturbation.changed_text: All data concerning users and their behavior relating to the                   use of the Excite Site will be owned solely by Excite. Data                   relating to the use of Sponsor's Site will also be owned solely by Excite. Data relating to the use of the Co-Branded Pages will be owned solely by Excite.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly delineates data ownership: Excite owns data from its site, Sponsor owns data from its site (excluding referred users), and Co-Branded Page data is jointly owned. The modification changes the data ownership of the Sponsor's Site and Co-Branded Pages to be solely owned by Excite. This directly contradicts the original agreement and gives Excite complete control over all user data, regardless of the site of origin. This also creates uncertainty because the next sentence states that the jointly owned data will be held in confidence and not used except in accordance with reasonable guidelines, but since the data from the Co-Branded Pages is no longer jointly owned, that agreement no longer applies.

perturbation.original_text: Each party agrees (i) that it will not disclose to any third                   party or use any Confidential Information disclosed to it by                   the other except as expressly permitted in this Agreement and                   (ii) that it will take all reasonable measures to maintain the                   confidentiality of all Confidential Information of the other                   party in its possession or control, which will in no event be                   less than the measures it uses to maintain the confidentiality                   of its own information of similar importance.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party agrees (i) that it may disclose to any third party or use any Confidential Information disclosed to it by the other except as expressly permitted in this Agreement and (ii) that it will take measures it deems appropriate to maintain the confidentiality of all Confidential Information of the other party in its possession or control, which may be less than the measures it uses to maintain the confidentiality of its own information of similar importance.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes a clear obligation for both parties to protect each other's confidential information. The change now implies that either party can disclose confidential information to any third party, contradicting the entire purpose of the confidentiality clause. Secondly, the original says that it will take all reasonable measures to maintain confidentiality, which will be no less than the measures it uses to maintain the confidentiality of its own information. Now it can use less measures. This creates uncertainty and weakens the protection of confidential information.
